Perceptor:::

"Master"said Perceptor while he walked along side with Megatron"May I 
suggest something? "


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> -- Megatron --
> 
> Megatron listens intently to Flicker as the bot explains his plan 
of 
> infiltrating the Maximal Base. The plan sounds feasible, and since 
> he wouldn't have to do anything but watch Flicker work, it suited 
> him fine.
> 
> "Hmmm, I will allow you to do this... In fact, this will work well 
> with my plans to attack the Tripredacus base. Those insolent fools 
> will pay for their stupidity." Megatron smiles cruelly, "We shall 
> attack as soon as you get to the Maximal Base. I, however, will not 
> be carrying one of those communicators, Switchblade will." 
> 
> Megatron motions for Switchblade to approach and take one. He 
wasn't 
> taking any chances, if there was a bomb or something like that in 
> the communication device, he didn't want to be wearing 
> it. "Switchblade."
> 
> "Yes Megs, you want me to wear the device as a precaution right?" 
> Switchblade nods in acceptance, "Alright, I'll do it then." He 
walks 
> over to Flicker, and takes one of the communication devices from 
> him, then waits for instructions on how to install it.
> 
> Megatron nods approval, then turns to the rest of the Predacons 
> pressent, "Now, the Tripredacus shall PAY. All Predacon troops move 
> out to the Tripred base, but approach silently, so as to not 
trigger 
> the sensory array." Megatron moves his hands over a console on his 
> chair.
> 
> An image of the world map that they'd compiled from exploration, 
and 
> from educated guessing, and Megatron put a little marker on it 
which 
> signified about where the Tripred base would be located.
> 
> "Predacons. MOVE OUT."
> 
> ooC: I hope that wasn't too hasty...
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > Flicker goes over to the computer and scans his communicators 
into 
> it 
> > and brings up a technical overview of them.
> > 
> > Flicker:  You see lord Megatron these communicators I designed 
are 
> > totally undetectable by standard communicators, something like 
> when 
> > Turantulas was talking to Black Aracnia via psychic link, only 
> they 
> > aren't implanted into your brain.  I intend to discuise myself as 
> a 
> > Maximal and hence get into their organization, and send you 
> > information on all their operations, it's that simple.
> >
